page.title: 15Religion
page.content: There is only one public place of worship in the village of Borgue. It is a large stone built Church of Scotland, which was extended in 1896. The money came from a bazaar held over two days in Borgue Academy. Sadly the Church is now too big for the local population, and only a small part is used. A service is held every second Sunday at 10.30am. Occaisionally, even services are held in the privately owned Kirkandrews Hall, which was built by the Brown family, a local landowner in 1908. The builder of this hall left it to be used by the parishioners for any service, social or political meeting. The present minister, Mr Bruce Ritchie, has another two parishes besides Borgue to administer.
